nodes.bodyText: @r00ta why not have the process metrics here in this example?
Hi @cristianonicolai , in this example a custom VisaApplicationPrometheusProcessEventListener is provided by the user, that's why with this config property we disable the creation of the default bean
@r00ta I think these type of test should be in the integration test module from kogito-runtimes, one for process and another for rules, would be quite valuable.

nodes.bodyText:
@r00ta I think it is fine to have -quarkus but would still make sense to keep suffix -addon.

             <artifactId>monitoring-prometheus-quarkus</artifactId>
          
          
            
             <artifactId>monitoring-prometheus-quarkus-addon</artifactId>
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,33 +13,20 @@ You will need:
   
 ### How to enable the feature
 
-Import the following dependency in your `pom.xml`:
+Import the following dependency in your `pom.xml` if you are using quarkus:
 
 ```XML
 <dependency>
  <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
- <artifactId>monitoring-prometheus-addon</artifactId>
+ <artifactId>monitoring-prometheus-quarkus</artifactId>

nodes.bodyText: @r00ta I usually prefer to have artifactId = folder name, but that's just my personal preference, although that seems to be the case for most of our modules. I don't think you need to change the common ones, but would be nice to keep consistent that only modules that are "user facing" end with -addon. So I guess not only adding -addon to -quarkus and -springboot, but also removing -addon from monitoring-addon and monitoring-prometheus-addon.
